Semantic Versioning Enforcer Rule

The Semantic Versioning Enforcer Rule is used to check your classes against previously released classes. Depending on changes your version number will be valid or not according to semantic versioning rules.

Rules Overview

The Semantic Versioning Enforcer Rule has the following rule.

  • checkVersionRule checks a project version number against an older release.

Examples

To provide you with better understanding of some usages of Semantic Versioning Enforcer Rule, you can take a look into the following example:

  • Checking a project's version against an older release
